_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Hi Plains Feed LLC of Garden City, Kansas is a liquid feed supplement manufacturer that specializes in producing bulk liquid feed supplements for beef and dairy.  Hi Plains Feed LLC strives to maintain a safe and healthy work place.  Our owners, managers, and employees have made every effort to plan the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.

The worst case and the alternate release scenarios have been evaluated and shared with our local first responders as part of an on-going training program.  More importantly, our employees have been trained in their respective emergency actions, including the emergency meeting place and each of their individual responsibilities regarding an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.    

Hi Plains Feed LLC maintains and operates their Anhydrous Ammonia Bulk System in strict accordance with all federal, state, and local authorities.  The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) inspects our plan on a regular basis and we comply with their requests for improvement.  Changes or improvements in the facility's equipment and SOP's will be acted upon immediately following the enforcement agency (EPA, OSHA, FDA, etc.) request, or as found to be necessary by our staff.    

Our employees are trained in safety procedures, site specific operating procedures, and plant maintenance.  Employees are competency tested over the training material.  Each employee uses ammonia proof goggles, gloves, and respirators, as well as, assurance plenty of emergency safety water is available during maintenance operations.

With the aforementioned training in mind, it makes it very easy to report that absolutely no injury actions or property damage has occurred at this facility for the past 5 years.  

Our emergency action plan is designed to minimize the risks to employees, the surrounding public, and the area first responders.  Hi Plains Feed LLC provides plant tours to our local fire department and our action plan has been shared with the Finn

ey County Emergency Management (FCEM) and the local emergency planning commission (LEPC).  Each of our responding agencies is aware of the dangerous nature of anhydrous ammonia and they have agreed to assist us in the event of an emergency or accidental release.  

Hi Plains Feed LLC is dedicated to the safety and well being of our employees.  We take a proactive approach in implementing, maintaining, and auditing all of our safety, health, and environmental programs.
